intro: Campanula simulans, commonly known as the bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Campanula simulans is often used in garden landscapes for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate.
